body: Well seems to be the same case as #255 after a closer look. I suddenly couldn't reproduce by turning case sensitivity on and off.

Ok, part about case-insensitivity is important to rule out (if possible). I saw a mention of this possibly having to with namespace difference (same local name, diff ns uri); if so, that is (alas) a known problem at this point.

But I will see whether XML module has case-insensitive tests at any rate: handling is not trivial so it better be tested.
I ended up using JAXB but would have preferred to use Jackson due to the Kotlin module which was SUPER awesome. Hopefully, we can fix the bug and then I can switch over üëç

@casz Understandable: purely considering XML part, JAXB is awesome lib/framework, since it started with and focuses solely on XML. I hope this problem (and related) can be solved as well as there's on the other hand lots of potential being able to cross formats, languages and datatypes.

Ok, I was able to reproduce the issue (and added a failing unit test). Based on that I managed to improve things slightly so that instead of NPE you now get "unexpected end of input" exception.

Actual underlying reasons is still unknown and unresolved. I did observe that replace start and end tags of `Element` with empty `<Element ... />` tag did, for some reason, actually remove the exception (although did not make things work fully as expected).
This is weird, but maybe would help figure out the underlying problem.

issue.title: No _valueDeserializer assigned when @JacksonXmlProperty.localName and field name have the same name.

repository.name: jackson-dataformat-xml
repository.description: Extension for Jackson JSON processor that adds support for serializing POJOs as XML (and deserializing from XML) as an alternative to JSON

issue.title: Bump com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat:jackson-dataformat-xml from 2.9.1 to 2.9.4

repository.name: HiRezAPI
repository.description: Reactive Java API Wrapper for Hi-Rez Studios games. (looking for maintainer)

issue.body:
Bumps [com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat:jackson-dataformat-xml](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml) from 2.9.1 to 2.9.4.
Commits - [`e6f8923`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/e6f8923b2bab8962f3ec96d398f2ab7ba1f372ea) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release jackson-dataformat-xml-2.9.4 - [`b8b8131`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/b8b8131263dd3616cbc25b48114b210620519256) update release notes - [`656e965`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/656e965a10aaab948b0c2a21a0d9fa177411299f) Fix a minor regression caused by `jackson-databind` 2.9.4 changes wrt special... - [`f1c30c5`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/f1c30c5738e5a6f258ce3ef5cdc9d5553c78de83) Prepare for 2.9.4 - [`7ac573b`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/7ac573b077529036c7d396ff776a571f3ed1a2a3) Add failing test for [#273](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/issues/273) - [`25485b8`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/25485b84a63dd46194a4cf84bf1e283f12dfba18) [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration - [`ac10d47`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/ac10d47821875105b7225d726b787d69d4ae4503) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release jackson-dataformat-xml-2.9.3 - [`c3525dd`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/c3525dd9b18bdaf0b88d6dcac10a708561e758aa) prepare for 2.9.3 - [`b54627d`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/b54627d73360280b7c53513bb4c0fe1f5426a089) Add a simple test to verify that case-insensitive handling works for regular ... - [`8de0cad`](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/commit/8de0cad692eaf99aa28ff19a276c5021cc696b42) [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/compare/jackson-dataformat-xml-2.9.1...jackson-dataformat-xml-2.9.4)

body:
Had another look, but still not sure what causes the problem. But since property name matching was rewritten for 3.0, including handling of case-sensitivity, seems likely this might only get fixed for 3.0.
Behavior at this point is slightly better for 3.0, but not yet correct.

Having another look at this, finally. I think I know where to look now: chances are this has to do with unwrapped Lists; probably start/end tag matching is not doing case-insensitivity as it should.

But the tricky part is, maybe surprisingly, that low-level XML parser (streaming API impl) has no concept of case-insensitivity, yet, all handled (currently) at databind layer.
But will see if knowledge is necessary or if it'd be possible to just rely on matching of start/end elements instead.
